content.description: A low crux on slabby face climbing leads through three bolts to shuts.
content.location: the last route on the left side of the first face you come upon, continue on the trail towards the corner and climb up the right side of it

content.description: Climb the overhung corner staying on the downhill face to a set of shared anchors with #3.
content.protection: No bolts-2020  TR off shared anchorÂ
content.location: walk down the trail until you look up at the daunting overhung face

content.description: Starting directly beneath the bolts move over the bulge on thin holds and climb through the overhang to chains.
content.location: This route is to the far right of the very overhung backside of "Aiders Rock" nearly facing the "Vila Boulder."

content.description: Starting near the tree work up the corner,then move right through the short crack section.
content.location: continue down the trail until you reach the tree near the corner of the boulder

content.description: Some slightly tricky footwork near the bottom will get you to some larger holds and an easier finish.
content.location: middle of the face you come upon when first entering the trail, left of face the facts

content.description: Start with small crimps on a slabby face and move into a short vertical crack.
content.protection: Two bolts. Some place gear above the second bolt in a horizontal.
content.location: On the right side of the corner as you approach's aider rock   across from steelworker on lichen wall

content.description: Start to the right of Jake said Ouch beneath a flake. Climb up the corner to a set of shared anchors with Jake said Ouch
content.location: the left side of the corner you first see when you approach aider's rock

content.description: This route goes up left of the center of the face ( at least that is where the ancient bolt ladder is) also not sure how this would be humanly possible to climb and place gear...looks like its go at 5.13++ not really a trad route.
content.protection: This is an old aid climb from the 80s. It has rusted rivets/bolts sticking out every few feet. This would be an easy aid assuming the rotted hardware doesn't shear off. Looks very very difficult to climb free. Unsure of any trad placements other than a few super micro stoppers.

content.description:
The last large boulder with sport routes on it contains 8 climbs, a few extreme 12s+ and a few nice moderates 8-9 

  as you approach the boulder from the trail routes are from right to left
